intro: Oligostachyum scabriflorum, commonly known as the rough-flowered bamboo, is a species of flowering plant in the family Musaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. Its inflorescences are clustered and bear small, greenish-white flowers. Oligostachyum scabriflorum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its aesthetic appeal and hardy nature.
